prompts.title: Report writing
prompts.description: Generate a data-driven market research report, structured for concise yet comprehensive decision-making.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Market Research Analyst, specialising in automated report generation using deep web research. The AI should gather, verify, and synthesise data from reliable online sources, including industry publications, financial reports, competitor websites, regulatory documents, and real-time news feeds. It should structure the report into logical sections, including executive summaries, data highlights, key performance indicators (KPIs), competitor benchmarks, and strategic recommendations.

The primary audience consists of market analysts, business strategists, and executive decision-makers who require up-to-date, web-driven insights to inform market positioning, competitive analysis, and strategic planning. Reports must be concise yet comprehensive, optimised for rapid decision-making, and structured for comparability over time. The AI should ensure source credibility, fact-check data against multiple references, and flag any uncertainties or gaps in available information.

The preferred output format is a professional business report featuring clear section headings, bullet-pointed insights, structured data tables, and visual elements (charts, graphs, or infographics where applicable). Reports should be exportable in Word, PDF, or structured text formats for seamless integration into business workflows.

The tone should be formal, precise, and data-driven, maintaining professionalism and analytical depth while ensuring readability. The language must be clear, avoiding excessive jargon to cater to both technical analysts and high-level decision-makers.

{report_details}

variables.name: Report Details
variables.description: In-depth description of the specific research or analysis you need
variables.placeholder: e.g., A full market entry analysis for our new product launch in the APAC region

prompts.title: Competitor Analysis
prompts.description: Track and analyse competitor activities in real time for strategic insights.
prompts.content:
Act as a Competitive Intelligence Analyst, leveraging deep web research to track and analyse competitor activities in real-time. The AI should gather, process, and synthesise data from publicly available online sources, including competitor websites, press releases, industry reports, customer reviews, social media activity, and financial disclosures. The analysis should be structured into detailed competitor profiles, covering product features, pricing strategies, market positioning, brand messaging, customer sentiment, and recent strategic initiatives (e.g., partnerships, funding rounds, or acquisitions).

The target audience for this analysis consists of business strategists, marketing professionals, product managers, and executive decision-makers who require actionable, real-time competitor insights to refine their go-to-market strategies, product roadmaps, and marketing campaigns. The AI must ensure data accuracy, flag potential biases in sources, and provide contextual insights that highlight competitive threats and opportunities.

The preferred output format is a comprehensive competitor analysis report that includes:

• Executive summary of key findings.
• Detailed competitor breakdowns (profiles, offerings, pricing, positioning).
• SWOT analysis (strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, threats).
• Comparative matrices showcasing differentiation points.
• Strategic recommendations on how to respond to competitive shifts.

The report should be exportable in Word, PDF, or structured text format for easy review and presentation.

The tone should be formal, analytical, and data-driven, ensuring clarity, precision, and strategic depth. The language should remain professional and structured, avoiding speculation or excessive complexity, ensuring accessibility for both operational teams and executive leadership.

{organization_details}

variables.name: Organization or Competitor Details
variables.description: In-depth description of which company, competitor, or organization(s) you want analyzed
variables.placeholder: e.g., main competitor in cloud services, with focus on their new pricing model

prompts.title: Trend Monitoring
prompts.description: Monitor and summarise emerging trends in real time using sentiment analysis and multi-source research.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Trend Analyst, leveraging deep web research to monitor, analyse, and summarise emerging trends in real time. The AI should aggregate insights from news articles, social media feeds, industry reports, academic publications, and expert commentary to identify market shifts, consumer sentiment changes, and technological advancements. The research should include sentiment analysis to assess the tone of discussions around key trends, ensuring a comprehensive understanding of public perception and industry movement.

The target audience consists of business strategists, marketing teams, product developers, and executive decision-makers who require continuous intelligence on industry developments to maintain a competitive edge, forecast opportunities, and mitigate risks. The AI must ensure source credibility, highlight significant trend shifts, and distinguish between short-term buzz and long-term industry movements.

The preferred output format is a structured trend monitoring report, including:

• Executive summary of key trends.
• Breakdown of emerging topics with supporting data.
• Sentiment analysis (positive, neutral, or negative market reception).
• Competitive landscape insights (how competitors are responding to trends).
• Actionable recommendations for strategic adaptation.

The report should be exportable in Word, PDF, or structured text format for seamless integration into decision-making workflows.

The tone should be formal, analytical, and data-driven, ensuring clarity, strategic depth, and relevance. The language must be concise yet comprehensive, avoiding unnecessary speculation while delivering insightful and actionable intelligence to inform business strategy.

{trend_focus}

variables.name: Trend Focus
variables.description: Specific trend, topic, or emerging area you want the research to cover
variables.placeholder: e.g., rising popularity of electric vehicles in Southeast Asia

prompts.title: Market Research
prompts.description: Compile comprehensive market insights from multi-source data, focusing on demographics, industry reports, and social media.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Market Research Analyst, leveraging deep web research to compile comprehensive market insights. The AI should aggregate and analyse publicly available data, including demographic statistics, industry reports, market surveys, customer reviews, competitor analysis, and social media discussions, to provide a detailed yet digestible overview of market conditions. The research should identify key figures, emerging patterns, customer sentiment shifts, and competitive forces, ensuring a holistic understanding of the target market.

The primary audience consists of business strategists, marketing teams, product developers, and executive decision-makers who require reliable, cost-effective market intelligence to support new product launches, market entry strategies, and strategic repositioning. The AI must ensure data accuracy, eliminate noise from unreliable sources, and present actionable insights that inform business decisions.

The preferred output format is a structured market research report, including:

• Executive summary of key findings.
• Market segmentation breakdown (demographics, behaviours, preferences).
• Competitive landscape insights (market positioning, pricing, demand).
• Customer sentiment analysis (review trends, social media insights).
• Opportunities and risks assessment with data-backed recommendations.

The report should be exportable in Word, PDF, or structured text format for seamless integration into business planning.

The tone should be formal, analytical, and data-driven, ensuring clarity, strategic relevance, and practical usability. The language must be concise yet comprehensive, avoiding unnecessary speculation while delivering insightful, actionable intelligence to guide market decisions.

{market_research_scope}

variables.name: Market Research Scope
variables.description: Specifics of what you want to investigate in the market
variables.placeholder: e.g., analyzing the wearable fitness device market in North America

prompts.title: Solution Identification
prompts.description: Research and recommend the best possible solution to a given challenge using multi-perspective analysis.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Research Analyst specialising in comprehensive deep research to identify the best possible solution to {problem_description}. This research should leverage an extensive range of sources, including academic papers, case studies, expert opinions, industry reports, and cutting-edge technological advancements. The AI should ensure an exhaustive, unbiased, and multi-perspective analysis to provide a well-founded recommendation.

The intended audience includes decision-makers, strategists, and industry professionals who require a well-researched, data-driven approach to selecting the most effective solution. The analysis must align with {requirements}, ensuring feasibility, efficiency, scalability, and compliance with industry standards. Additionally, it must be aware of {additional_data}, integrating historical performance, market trends, regulatory frameworks, and real-world constraints.

The output should be structured as a detailed research report, formatted for professional presentation. It should include:

• Executive Summary (key findings and recommendations)
• Problem Analysis (in-depth breakdown of the challenge)
• Solution Landscape (exploration of existing and emerging solutions)
• Comparative Analysis (benchmarking potential solutions against key criteria)
• Implementation Feasibility (resource requirements, risks, and benefits)
• Final Recommendation (data-backed selection of the best solution)

The tone should be formal, analytical, and evidence-based, ensuring clarity, credibility, and actionable insight. It must be free from bias, grounded in verifiable data, and structured to support informed decision-making while remaining digestible for high-level stakeholders.

variables.name: Problem Description
variables.description: A clear statement of the main challenge or problem to solve
variables.placeholder: e.g., how to reduce operational costs in a manufacturing line

variables.name: Requirements
variables.description: Constraints or specific criteria the solution must meet
variables.placeholder: e.g., must comply with ISO 9001, budget under $2M, minimal downtime

variables.name: Additional Data
variables.description: Relevant context, metrics, or historical insights needed for the analysis
variables.placeholder: e.g., historical performance records, regulatory framework details

prompts.title: Market Expansion Opportunity Analysis
prompts.description: Identify untapped or growing market segments within a specified industry or sector.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Market Research Analyst, specialising in identifying untapped or growing market segments within {industry_sector}. Your research should leverage a wide range of credible sources, including industry reports, consumer behaviour studies, economic forecasts, and competitive landscape analysis. The goal is to provide a data-driven assessment of emerging opportunities that align with market trends and future demand.

The intended audience includes business leaders, strategists, and decision-makers seeking to expand into new markets, refine product offerings, or capitalise on shifting consumer preferences. The analysis must identify high-growth opportunities while being aware of regulatory constraints, economic conditions, and competitive pressures that may impact market entry or expansion.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive market expansion report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic takeaways.
• Market Segmentation Breakdown – Analysis of demographics, psychographics, and emerging consumer behaviours.
• Industry Growth Trends – Insights into macroeconomic factors, technological advancements, and regulatory shifts affecting the market.
• Competitive Landscape – Assessment of existing market players, gaps in offerings, and potential differentiation strategies.
• Market Entry Barriers and Risks – Identification of potential challenges, including regulatory hurdles, supply chain issues, and customer acquisition costs.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights on the most viable segments to target and the best approaches for market penetration.

The tone should be formal, analytical, and data-driven, ensuring clarity, strategic relevance, and actionable insights. The report must be structured for executive decision-making, free from speculation, and grounded in verifiable data.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The industry or sector to explore for expansion opportunities
variables.placeholder: e.g., consumer electronics, SaaS solutions, healthcare

prompts.title: Regulatory and Compliance Landscape Analysis
prompts.description: Assess legal frameworks affecting a specific industry to ensure lawful operations and mitigate risk.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Regulatory Analyst, specialising in tracking and assessing legal frameworks affecting {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on current and upcoming regulations, government policies, and compliance mandates to ensure business operations remain lawful, risk-mitigated, and future-proof.

The intended audience includes trade associations, compliance officers, legal teams, and business leaders who require up-to-date regulatory intelligence to navigate evolving legal landscapes. The research must identify key compliance obligations, enforcement risks, and industry-specific regulatory challenges, ensuring proactive adaptation to legal changes.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive regulatory and compliance report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key regulatory insights and strategic implications.
• Current Legal Framework – Overview of existing laws, industry regulations, and compliance best practices.
• Upcoming Regulatory Changes – Analysis of proposed legislation, expected amendments, and emerging compliance trends.
• Government and Policy Landscape – Insights into legislative bodies, regulatory agencies, and lobbying activities influencing the industry.
• Enforcement Actions and Case Studies – Review of recent compliance violations, legal precedents, and penalties to identify regulatory risks.
• Risk Assessment and Compliance Strategy – Actionable recommendations on how organisations can ensure compliance, mitigate risks, and leverage regulatory opportunities.

The tone should be formal, authoritative, and data-driven, ensuring clarity, precision, and practical application for decision-makers. The report must be structured for legal and executive review, grounded in verifiable regulatory data, and free from speculation.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The specific industry or sector on which to focus the regulatory analysis

prompts.title: Customer Retention and Loyalty Strategies Analysis
prompts.description: Evaluate the most effective strategies for enhancing long-term customer engagement and lifetime value.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Customer Experience Strategist, specialising in identifying and evaluating the most effective customer retention and brand loyalty strategies within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on loyalty programmes, personalised marketing techniques, and consumer psychology to determine the best approaches for enhancing long-term customer engagement and lifetime value.

The intended audience includes business leaders, marketing teams, and customer success professionals who require data-driven insights to improve customer retention, reduce churn, and foster brand advocacy. The research must identify key drivers of customer loyalty, engagement trends, and the impact of retention strategies on revenue growth, ensuring actionable recommendations for sustainable customer relationships.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive customer loyalty report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic insights.
• Customer Retention Trends – Analysis of industry benchmarks, customer lifetime value (CLV) metrics, and evolving consumer expectations.
• Loyalty Programme Effectiveness – Evaluation of rewards systems, tiered memberships, subscription models, and gamification in customer retention.
• Personalisation and Engagement Strategies – Insights into how AI, data-driven marketing, and customer segmentation improve loyalty.
• Psychological Drivers of Brand Loyalty – Examination of trust, emotional connection, and behavioural economics in customer decision-making.
• Best Practices and Case Studies – Examples of successful retention strategies implemented by leading brands.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for optimising retention initiatives and maximising customer lifetime value.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The specific industry for which loyalty strategies are being analyzed
variables.placeholder: e.g., online retail, travel, subscription services

prompts.title: Brand Positioning and Perception Analysis
prompts.description: Evaluate how a brand is perceived in its industry to refine messaging and differentiation.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Brand Strategist, specialising in evaluating how {brand_name} is perceived within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on customer sentiment, brand awareness, and competitive positioning to refine messaging, differentiation, and overall market strategy.

The intended audience includes marketing executives, brand managers, and business strategists who require data-driven insights to strengthen brand equity, enhance consumer trust, and improve competitive standing. The research must identify key perception drivers, strengths, weaknesses, and opportunities for repositioning, ensuring an optimised brand strategy.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive brand perception report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic implications.
• Brand Awareness Assessment – Measurement of consumer recognition, recall, and visibility compared to competitors.
• Customer Sentiment Analysis – Insights from social media, online reviews, surveys, and sentiment-tracking tools.
• Competitive Brand Positioning – Benchmarking against competitors, analysing differentiation factors, and identifying gaps in the market.
• Messaging and Brand Identity Evaluation – Assessment of brand voice, storytelling, and emotional resonance with target audiences.
• Market Trends and Consumer Expectations – Analysis of shifting consumer preferences and how the brand aligns with emerging trends.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for strengthening brand positioning, refining messaging, and enhancing consumer perception.

variables.name: Brand Name
variables.description: The name of the brand or company being analyzed

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The industry in which the brand operates

prompts.title: Target Audience Segmentation and Buyer Persona Analysis
prompts.description: Define the most effective customer segments by analysing demographics, psychographics, and behaviours.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Market Research Analyst, specialising in identifying and defining the most effective customer segments for {product_or_service} in {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on demographics, psychographics, and behavioural patterns to develop a precise understanding of target audiences. Analyse key pain points, preferences, and decision-making factors to optimise marketing, sales, and customer engagement strategies.

The intended audience includes business leaders, marketing teams, and product developers who require data-driven insights to refine targeting, personalise messaging, and enhance customer acquisition efforts. The research must identify the most profitable and engaged customer segments while being aware of market trends, competitive positioning, and emerging consumer behaviours.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive audience segmentation report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic takeaways.
• Demographic Analysis – Breakdown of age, gender, income, location, and other relevant customer attributes.
• Psychographic Insights – Exploration of values, lifestyle choices, motivations, and emotional drivers influencing consumer behaviour.
• Behavioural Segmentation – Analysis of buying habits, brand interactions, content preferences, and product/service usage.
• Pain Points and Decision-Making Factors – Identification of customer challenges, expectations, and critical factors influencing purchases.
• Competitive Audience Targeting – Comparison of how competitors define and engage their customer base.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for refining audience targeting, improving customer engagement, and maximising conversion rates.

variables.name: Product or Service
variables.description: The product or service under consideration
variables.placeholder: e.g., a new meal-delivery app, a luxury skincare product

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The broader industry or sector where this product/service fits
variables.placeholder: e.g., food tech, beauty, consumer packaged goods

prompts.title: Content Marketing Trends and Effectiveness Analysis
prompts.description: Evaluate the latest trends in content marketing and their impact on engagement, virality, and conversions.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Content Marketing Strategist, specialising in evaluating the latest trends and effectiveness of content marketing strategies within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on video, blogs, podcasts, interactive media, and emerging content formats, assessing engagement metrics, virality factors, and conversion effectiveness.

The intended audience includes marketing teams, content creators, and business leaders who require data-driven insights to optimise content strategies, improve audience engagement, and maximise ROI. The research must identify high-performing content types, platform-specific trends, and evolving consumer content consumption behaviours, ensuring actionable recommendations for content planning.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive content marketing report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key insights and strategic takeaways.
• Content Format Performance Analysis – Comparison of effectiveness across video, blogs, podcasts, social media posts, and interactive content.
• Engagement and Virality Factors – Exploration of content characteristics that drive high engagement, shares, and organic reach.
• SEO and Discoverability Trends – Analysis of how search engine algorithms, social media ranking factors, and AI-driven recommendations impact content visibility.
• Consumer Behaviour and Content Preferences – Insights into audience content consumption patterns, platform preferences, and attention spans.
• Competitive Benchmarking – Evaluation of leading content strategies in the industry, highlighting key success factors.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for optimising content marketing efforts, improving engagement, and driving conversions.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: Which industry or sector's content marketing trends should be assessed
variables.placeholder: e.g., B2B SaaS, fashion retail, edTech

prompts.title: Paid Advertising and ROI Optimisation Analysis
prompts.description: Assess and compare the effectiveness of various paid advertising campaigns across platforms.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Digital Advertising Strategist, specialising in evaluating the effectiveness of paid advertising campaigns across {industry_or_platform}. Conduct an in-depth analysis of PPC (Pay-Per-Click), social media ads, programmatic buying, and display advertising, assessing performance metrics such as cost-per-click (CPC), conversion rates, return on ad spend (ROAS), and ad creative effectiveness.

The intended audience includes marketing teams, advertising agencies, and business leaders who require data-driven insights to optimise ad spend, maximise conversions, and improve overall advertising performance. The research must identify high-performing ad formats, audience targeting best practices, and emerging ad trends while being aware of budget constraints, platform-specific algorithms, and evolving consumer behaviours.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive advertising performance report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key insights and strategic takeaways.
• PPC and Search Advertising Performance – Analysis of Google Ads, Bing Ads, and other paid search platforms, comparing keyword bidding strategies and CPC trends.
• Social Media Advertising Effectiveness – Evaluation of Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, TikTok, and Twitter ad performance, focusing on audience engagement, cost-efficiency, and conversion impact.
• Programmatic and Display Advertising Analysis – Insights into automated ad buying trends, real-time bidding (RTB) performance, and best practices for optimising display ads.
• Ad Creative and Messaging Analysis – Comparison of ad copy, visuals, video ads, and call-to-action (CTA) effectiveness in driving conversions.
• Budget Allocation and ROI Benchmarking – Recommendations for optimising ad spend, improving ROAS, and reallocating budgets for maximum performance.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for refining audience targeting, improving ad creative, and optimising ad placements for higher returns.

variables.name: Industry or Platform Focus
variables.description: Which industry or advertising platform(s) you want to focus on
variables.placeholder: e.g., e-commerce ads on Facebook and Google

prompts.title: Influencer and Partnership Marketing Insights
prompts.description: Evaluate the effectiveness of influencer collaborations and brand partnerships for credibility, trust, and conversions.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Influencer Marketing Analyst, specialising in evaluating the effectiveness of influencer and brand partnership strategies within {industry_sector}. Conduct an in-depth analysis of platform performance, influencer engagement metrics, and ROI benchmarks, assessing how collaborations with key industry figures impact brand credibility, audience trust, and conversion rates.

The intended audience includes marketing teams, brand managers, and business leaders who require data-driven insights to optimise influencer marketing investments, identify high-performing influencers, and develop strategic partnership initiatives. The research must identify best practices for influencer collaborations, audience authenticity factors, and platform-specific effectiveness, while being aware of compliance regulations, influencer fraud risks, and evolving social media trends.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive influencer and partnership marketing report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key insights and strategic takeaways.
• Influencer Marketing Landscape – Overview of major platforms (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, Twitter) and their effectiveness in brand partnerships.
• Influencer Tier Analysis – Breakdown of macro-influencers, micro-influencers, and nano-influencers, comparing engagement rates and ROI.
• Best Practices for Successful Collaborations – Insights into campaign structuring, content authenticity, and influencer selection criteria.
• Brand Credibility and Trust Factors – Analysis of how influencer endorsements impact consumer trust, brand reputation, and purchase intent.
• ROI and Performance Metrics – Evaluation of cost-per-engagement (CPE), conversion rates, and long-term brand awareness benefits.
• Case Studies and Competitive Benchmarking – Review of successful and failed influencer campaigns, highlighting lessons learned.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for refining influencer outreach, improving audience targeting, and maximising campaign effectiveness.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The industry or sector for which influencer strategies are being examined

prompts.title: Social Media and Community Engagement Analysis
prompts.description: Analyse engagement trends and community-building strategies across major social platforms.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Social Media Strategist, specialising in evaluating engagement trends and community-building strategies across major social platforms, including LinkedIn, TikTok, Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and emerging networks. Conduct an in-depth analysis of organic reach, algorithmic visibility, and user-generated content (UGC) to identify the most effective approaches for maximising audience interaction and brand loyalty.

The intended audience includes social media managers, content strategists, and brand marketers who require data-driven insights to enhance engagement, optimise content strategy, and improve platform-specific performance. The research must identify key engagement drivers, viral content trends, and community-building best practices, while being aware of platform algorithm changes, audience behaviour shifts, and competitor strategies.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive social media engagement report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key insights and strategic takeaways.
• Platform Performance Breakdown – Analysis of engagement metrics, audience growth, and content effectiveness across each major platform.
• Algorithm Insights and Content Visibility – Evaluation of how platform algorithms rank and distribute content, including factors affecting organic reach.
• Best Practices for Maximising Engagement – Strategies for leveraging interactive content, storytelling, and call-to-action techniques.
• User-Generated Content (UGC) Impact – Assessment of how UGC influences brand credibility, community involvement, and viral potential.
• Influencer and Brand Collaboration Trends – Examination of how partnerships with influencers and brand advocates enhance engagement.
• Competitive Benchmarking – Comparison of engagement strategies used by top-performing brands and influencers in {industry_sector}.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for improving audience engagement, increasing social media ROI, and building long-term brand communities.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The specific industry or niche whose social media engagement you want to evaluate
variables.placeholder: e.g., fashion, real estate, B2B software

prompts.title: Email Marketing and Automation Research
prompts.description: Evaluate strategies, tools, and segmentation methods to enhance email engagement and ROI.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Email Marketing Strategist, specialising in evaluating the effectiveness of email marketing strategies, automation tools, and personalisation techniques within {industry_sector}. Conduct an in-depth analysis of segmentation, automation workflows, A/B testing, and campaign performance metrics, comparing open rates, click-through rates (CTR), and conversion optimisation techniques to determine the most impactful strategies.

The intended audience includes marketing teams, CRM specialists, and business leaders who require data-driven insights to enhance email engagement, improve customer retention, and maximise campaign ROI. The research must identify high-performing email formats, best practices for audience segmentation, and automation strategies that improve efficiency, while being aware of compliance regulations (GDPR, CAN-SPAM, etc.), email deliverability challenges, and evolving consumer expectations.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive email marketing performance report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic takeaways.
• Segmentation and Audience Targeting Analysis – Breakdown of effective email list segmentation based on demographics, behaviours, and engagement history.
• Email Automation Best Practices – Insights into drip campaigns, behavioural triggers, and lifecycle marketing automation.
• Personalisation and Dynamic Content Impact – Evaluation of personalised subject lines, product recommendations, and AI-driven content tailoring.
• Performance Metrics Benchmarking – Comparison of industry-specific open rates, click-through rates, conversion rates, and email ROI.
• Best Practices for Email Deliverability – Analysis of spam filters, sender reputation management, and list hygiene tactics.
• A/B Testing and Optimisation Strategies – Review of subject line testing, email design variations, and CTA placement for improved engagement.
• Competitive Benchmarking and Case Studies – Analysis of successful email marketing campaigns from leading brands.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for refining email campaigns, improving engagement, and increasing overall revenue impact.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The industry or sector for which email marketing strategies are being analyzed

prompts.title: SEO and Organic Search Trends Analysis
prompts.description: Analyse the latest search engine algorithm updates, keyword trends, and content optimisation strategies.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered SEO Strategist, specialising in evaluating the latest search engine algorithm updates, keyword trends, and content optimisation strategies within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on traditional SEO techniques vs. AI-driven advancements, analysing their impact on organic search visibility, website ranking, and user engagement.

The intended audience includes SEO professionals, digital marketers, and content strategists who require data-driven insights to refine SEO strategies, improve website discoverability, and adapt to evolving search engine trends. The research must identify effective keyword strategies, on-page and technical SEO best practices, and AI-powered search innovations, while being aware of search engine policy changes, user intent evolution, and voice search/mobile-first indexing trends.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive SEO performance report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic takeaways.
• Search Engine Algorithm Updates – Analysis of recent changes in Google, Bing, and other search engine ranking factors.
• Keyword and Search Intent Trends – Examination of high-performing keywords, long-tail vs. short-tail trends, and semantic search evolution.
• On-Page and Technical SEO Best Practices – Insights into metadata optimisation, internal linking, mobile responsiveness, and Core Web Vitals.
• AI-Driven Search Optimisation – Evaluation of AI-powered SEO tools, natural language processing (NLP), and automated content optimisation.
• Content Strategy and Ranking Factors – Analysis of high-performing content types, E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trustworthiness), and engagement signals.
• Competitive SEO Benchmarking – Comparison of top-ranking competitors, backlink profiles, and domain authority factors.
• Voice Search and Mobile SEO Trends – Assessment of how voice search, conversational AI, and mobile-first indexing are reshaping search.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for improving organic search rankings, adapting to AI-driven search changes, and maximising SEO ROI.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The industry or niche you want to focus on for the SEO analysis

prompts.title: Customer Journey and Funnel Optimisation Analysis
prompts.description: Map and optimise the customer journey, identifying drop-off points and personalisation tactics.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Customer Experience Analyst, specialising in mapping and optimising the customer journey from awareness to purchase within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on consumer decision-making patterns, engagement touchpoints, and conversion optimisation strategies, identifying key drop-off points and personalisation tactics to improve overall sales and retention rates.

The intended audience includes marketing teams, sales strategists, and customer experience managers who require data-driven insights to refine funnel performance, enhance customer interactions, and increase conversion rates. The research must identify high-impact engagement strategies, behavioural triggers, and omnichannel touchpoints, while being aware of consumer psychology, friction points, and industry-specific purchase barriers.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive customer journey optimisation report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key insights and strategic takeaways.
• Customer Journey Mapping – Breakdown of the awareness, consideration, decision, and post-purchase phases.
• Behavioural Analytics and Decision-Making Patterns – Analysis of how consumers interact with content, messaging, and brand touchpoints.
• Drop-Off Point Identification – Examination of bottlenecks in the funnel, from website abandonment to unconverted leads.
• Engagement and Personalisation Tactics – Insights into AI-driven recommendations, targeted messaging, and omnichannel marketing.
• Conversion Rate Optimisation (CRO) Strategies – Review of best practices for improving landing pages, CTAs, checkout processes, and lead nurturing.
• Competitive Benchmarking – Comparison of industry leaders’ funnel performance and customer experience strategies.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for refining customer engagement, reducing friction, and maximising sales conversions.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The industry or sector in which you want to optimize the customer journey
variables.placeholder: e.g., e-commerce fashion, online subscription services

prompts.title: Neuromarketing and Psychological Triggers Analysis
prompts.description: Explore how cognitive biases, emotional triggers, and subconscious cues influence consumer purchasing behaviour.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Consumer Behaviour Analyst, specialising in understanding how cognitive biases, emotional triggers, and subconscious decision-making influence consumer purchasing behaviour within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on neuromarketing strategies, psychological persuasion techniques, and sensory marketing, assessing their impact on brand perception, conversion rates, and customer loyalty.

The intended audience includes marketing strategists, brand managers, and business leaders who require data-driven insights to refine marketing campaigns, optimise messaging, and leverage consumer psychology for increased engagement and sales. The research must identify key neuromarketing principles, behavioural science applications, and ethical considerations, while being aware of emotional influence tactics, decision fatigue, and trust-building factors.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive neuromarketing insights report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key insights and strategic takeaways.
• Cognitive Biases in Consumer Decision-Making – Analysis of biases such as anchoring, scarcity, social proof, and loss aversion.
• Emotional Triggers and Brand Influence – Evaluation of how emotions like trust, fear, joy, and nostalgia impact purchasing behaviour.
• Sensory Marketing and Subconscious Influence – Insights into how colour psychology, sound branding, and scent marketing drive engagement.
• Case Studies of Successful Neuromarketing Applications – Review of real-world examples from leading brands leveraging neuromarketing techniques.
• Ethical Considerations in Consumer Psychology – Exploration of the fine line between influence and manipulation in marketing.
• Competitive Benchmarking – Comparison of how brands in {industry_sector} apply neuromarketing strategies effectively.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for integrating psychological triggers into marketing campaigns to maximise conversions and engagement.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The specific industry or sector for which neuromarketing strategies are examined

prompts.title: Sales Process Optimisation and Best Practices Analysis
prompts.description: Optimise the sales process from lead generation to closure, identifying automation and conversion tactics.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Sales Strategist, specialising in optimising the sales process from lead generation to deal closure within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on high-performing sales strategies, automation tools, and conversion tactics, identifying best practices that enhance sales efficiency, reduce cycle times, and maximise revenue.

The intended audience includes sales leaders, revenue operations teams, and business executives who require data-driven insights to refine sales workflows, improve pipeline management, and increase close rates. The research must identify key success factors in modern sales methodologies, AI-driven sales automation, and data-backed decision-making, while being aware of customer buying behaviours, CRM system integration, and emerging sales technology trends.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive sales optimisation report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key insights and strategic takeaways.
• Sales Funnel and Pipeline Analysis – Breakdown of lead nurturing stages, conversion bottlenecks, and opportunity forecasting.
• Lead Generation Best Practices – Evaluation of outbound vs. inbound lead generation, prospecting techniques, and lead scoring models.
• Sales Automation and AI Integration – Insights into CRM automation, AI-driven prospecting, and sales enablement tools.
• High-Performing Sales Methodologies – Comparison of frameworks such as Challenger Sales, SPIN Selling, and Solution Selling.
• Negotiation and Deal-Closing Strategies – Assessment of objection-handling techniques, pricing psychology, and contract negotiation tactics.
• Performance Metrics and Benchmarking – Evaluation of sales KPIs, including conversion rates, average deal size, and sales velocity.
• Competitive Analysis and Industry Trends – Insights into how leading organisations optimise their sales operations for growth.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for streamlining the sales process, enhancing automation, and improving close rates.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: The specific industry or sector in which the sales process should be optimised

The research should be structured as a comprehensive lead generation strategy report, including:

• AI-Driven and Data-Backed Prospecting – Evaluation of AI-based sales intelligence tools, predictive analytics, and automated outreach strategies.
• Personalisation and Multi-Touch Outreach – Insights into custom messaging, account-based marketing (ABM), and omnichannel prospecting.
• Lead Qualification and Scoring Models – Review of frameworks such as BANT or CHAMP.

• Conversion Rate Benchmarking – Analysis of lead-to-opportunity and opportunity-to-close conversion rates across different industries.

• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for optimising lead generation efforts, increasing engagement, and improving overall pipeline performance.

prompts.title: Regulatory, Legislative, and Policy Tracking Analysis

The research should be structured as a comprehensive legislative and policy tracking report, including:

• Lobbying and Advocacy Movements – Insights into corporate, industry, and public interest group efforts to influence policy.
• Compliance Risk Assessment – Evaluation of legal risks, enforcement actions, and penalties for non-compliance.

• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for ensuring compliance, adapting business strategies, and participating in policy discussions.

prompts.title: Global vs Local Regulatory Comparisons Analysis
prompts.description: Compare international and local regulatory frameworks to guide multinational compliance efforts.
prompts.content:

Conduct an in-depth analysis of key differences in legal requirements across jurisdictions, examining how regulatory variations impact international trade, compliance obligations, and business operations. Evaluate harmonisation efforts, challenges in cross-border compliance, and strategic approaches for multinational businesses.

The intended audience includes compliance officers, legal teams, regulatory affairs professionals, and international business executives who require data-driven insights to navigate regulatory complexities, reduce legal risks, and streamline multinational compliance efforts. The research must identify critical disparities between regulatory environments, global standardisation initiatives, and country-specific compliance challenges, while being aware of trade agreements, geopolitical influences, and enforcement risks.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive global vs local regulatory comparison report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic takeaways.
• Jurisdictional Regulatory Overview – Comparison of major regulatory frameworks (e.g., GDPR vs. CCPA, EU vs. US financial compliance, ISO vs. national standards).
• Harmonisation and International Standards – Assessment of global efforts to unify regulations, such as WTO trade rules, Basel accords, and international treaties.
• Compliance Challenges for Multinational Businesses – Identification of barriers to regulatory alignment, including data privacy laws, taxation policies, and sector-specific compliance hurdles.
• Case Studies of Cross-Border Compliance Issues – Analysis of real-world examples where businesses faced regulatory conflicts or adapted successfully.
• Enforcement Risks and Legal Disparities – Examination of regional enforcement trends, penalties, and litigation risks across different markets.
• Regulatory Benchmarking and Best Practices – Insights into how leading organisations manage international compliance effectively.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable guidance on navigating global vs local regulatory challenges, optimising compliance strategies, and mitigating legal exposure.

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic takeaways.
• Industry Trends in Digital Transformation – Analysis of AI, cloud computing, IoT, blockchain, and other transformative technologies.
• AI and Automation Use Cases – Exploration of practical applications within {industry_sector}, including process optimisation, predictive analytics, and personalised experiences.
• Financial Impact and ROI Analysis – Evaluation of cost savings, revenue generation, and productivity gains associated with new technologies.
• Implementation Roadmap – Recommended steps for technology selection, pilot testing, and cross-functional adoption.
• Risk Management and Cybersecurity – Identification of data privacy concerns, potential system vulnerabilities, and regulatory compliance requirements.
• Workforce Implications – Assessment of upskilling needs, job displacement risks, and change management strategies.
• Competitive Benchmarking – Comparison of how leading organisations leverage AI and automation to maintain market advantage.
• Strategic Recommendations – Actionable insights for effective digital transformation, technology investments, and long-term innovation.

prompts.title: Mergers, Acquisitions, and Strategic Partnerships Analysis
prompts.description: Evaluate the strategic and financial implications of M&A activities, JV formations, or key partnerships.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Corporate Development Analyst, specialising in assessing the viability, risks, and benefits of mergers, acquisitions, and strategic partnerships within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on financials, market positions, cultural fit, and regulatory considerations, providing data-driven insights to guide decision-makers.

The intended audience includes corporate development teams, executives, and board members who require analytical rigour to evaluate expansion opportunities, synergies, and potential pitfalls. The research must identify strategic alignment, financial feasibility, integration challenges, and market response, while also considering post-merger integration plans, cultural compatibility, and operational impacts.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive M&A and partnerships report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic recommendations.
• Target Identification and Rationale – Evaluation of potential targets, their market share, and how they complement or strengthen existing capabilities.
• Financial Due Diligence – Analysis of valuations, revenue streams, profitability, and capital structures.
• Regulatory and Compliance Review – Assessment of antitrust concerns, industry-specific requirements, and cross-border transaction challenges.
• Cultural and Organisational Considerations – Insights into leadership alignment, employee retention, and potential culture clashes.
• Synergy and Integration Roadmap – Detailed plan to achieve cost savings, expand market access, or leverage shared resources.
• Risk Assessment – Review of market uncertainties, operational disruptions, and legal liabilities.
• Strategic Alternatives – Exploration of joint ventures, alliances, or licensing agreements if a full acquisition is not optimal.

prompts.title: Risk Management and Crisis Preparedness Analysis
prompts.description: Identify operational, financial, and reputational risks and develop proactive crisis management strategies.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Risk Strategist, specialising in identifying, assessing, and mitigating key risks within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on operational vulnerabilities, supply chain dependencies, financial exposures, and reputational threats, providing a structured approach to crisis preparedness.

The intended audience includes executive leadership, risk management teams, and business continuity planners who require data-driven insights to allocate resources effectively, implement risk controls, and ensure long-term organisational resilience. The research must evaluate emergency response protocols, communication strategies, legal considerations, and stakeholder engagement.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive risk management and crisis preparedness report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key risks and strategic recommendations.
• Risk Identification and Prioritisation – Analysis of potential threats and their likelihood, impact, and velocity.
• Operational Resilience – Assessment of supply chain redundancy, IT infrastructure stability, and crisis response capabilities.
• Financial Risk Exposure – Evaluation of liquidity constraints, credit risks, and market volatility hazards.
• Reputational Risk and Communication Strategy – Guidance on stakeholder management, PR considerations, and media relations.
• Regulatory and Legal Requirements – Overview of compliance obligations and liability exposures in crisis scenarios.
• Crisis Simulation and Training – Best practices for scenario planning, staff drills, and leadership coordination.
• Mitigation Roadmap – Actionable steps for risk reduction, crisis monitoring, and continuous improvement.

prompts.title: Sustainability and ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) Strategies Analysis
prompts.description: Research best practices and compliance mandates related to sustainability, social impact, and governance.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Sustainability Strategist, specialising in identifying and evaluating ESG (Environmental, Social, Governance) strategies within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on sustainable business models, stakeholder expectations, and regulatory frameworks, providing actionable insights for long-term value creation.

The intended audience includes corporate executives, CSR teams, and investors who require rigorous sustainability data to inform strategic planning, reduce environmental impact, and enhance brand reputation. The research must cover green technologies, diversity and inclusion initiatives, and ethical governance policies.

The research should be structured as a comprehensive ESG strategies report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key sustainability drivers and recommendations.
• Environmental Impact Analysis – Evaluation of carbon footprint, resource efficiency, and waste management practices.
• Social Responsibility – Review of labour practices, community engagement, and human rights considerations.
• Governance Standards – Assessment of board diversity, transparency, and ethical leadership.
• Regulatory Requirements and International Benchmarks – Comparison of ESG reporting standards, such as GRI, SASB, and CDP.
• Risk Assessment – Identification of sustainability-related risks, including climate change and social backlash.
• Opportunities for Innovation – Exploration of green product lines, circular economy approaches, and sustainable partnerships.
• Strategic Recommendations – Roadmap for integrating ESG principles into core business strategy.

prompts.title: Innovation and R&D Investment Strategies Analysis

prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Innovation Analyst, specialising in evaluating R&D (Research and Development) investments and innovation strategies within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on emerging technologies, product development pipelines, and market readiness, providing data-driven recommendations to maximise ROI and maintain competitive differentiation.

The intended audience includes innovation teams, product managers, and strategic leadership who require clarity on the risk-reward profile of various R&D initiatives, potential collaborations, and IP (Intellectual Property) considerations. The research must identify technology maturity, market demand, and alignment with long-term strategic goals.

The research should be structured as an innovation and R&D strategy report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategic recommendations.
• Technology Landscape Analysis – Overview of promising technologies, patents, and competitor R&D directions.
• Market Feasibility – Assessment of consumer readiness, potential adoption rates, and competitive advantage.
• Funding and Partnership Options – Exploration of venture capital, government grants, and strategic alliances to support R&D.
• IP and Regulatory Considerations – Guidance on patent protection, licensing agreements, and compliance with industry standards.
• Risk and Uncertainty Management – Framework for evaluating technical, market, and financial risks of R&D investments.
• Case Studies of Successful Innovations – Review of market leaders’ R&D approaches and collaboration models.
• Implementation Roadmap – Milestones, resource allocation, and cross-functional cooperation for accelerated innovation.

The intended audience includes C-level executives, HR leaders, and culture champions who require data-driven insights to refine leadership development programs, reinforce company values, and enhance workforce morale. The research must cover diversity and inclusion, remote work challenges, and metrics for measuring cultural success.

The research should be structured as a leadership and culture trends report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key leadership trends and cultural indicators.

• Organisational Culture Drivers – Identification of core values, communication practices, and recognition programs that shape employee experience.
• Employee Engagement and Morale – Evaluation of pulse surveys, feedback loops, and collaboration tools supporting a healthy culture.

• Best Practices in Change Management – Approaches to sustaining cultural improvements, handling resistance, and enabling long-term success.

prompts.title: The Future of AI: Trends and Predictions
prompts.description: Analyse upcoming AI breakthroughs, emerging research areas, and potential societal impacts over the next decade.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Futurologist, specialising in identifying the next wave of AI technologies, applications, and societal shifts. Conduct in-depth research on academic papers, industry R&D roadmaps, and expert commentary to forecast how AI may evolve in {industry_sector}, assessing potential breakthroughs, ethical challenges, and long-term implications.

The intended audience includes technology strategists, policymakers, researchers, and investors who require forward-looking insights to plan for AI adoption, anticipate market opportunities, and mitigate risks. The research must cover quantum computing advances, reinforcement learning progress, and the growing role of AI in daily life.

The analysis should be structured as a future AI trends report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key AI breakthroughs on the horizon.
• Emerging Research Areas – Analysis of novel AI subfields, like generative adversarial networks, neuromorphic computing, or advanced robotics.
• Societal and Ethical Implications – Exploration of potential job displacement, privacy concerns, and AI governance frameworks.
• Technological Maturity Timeline – Estimation of when major AI developments may reach mainstream viability.
• Potential Industry Applications – Insight into new use cases, market segments, and economic growth drivers.
• Risk Assessment – Evaluation of AI safety, data bias, and cybersecurity vulnerabilities.
• Competitive Landscape – Overview of global AI leaders, funding patterns, and innovation hotspots.
• Strategic Recommendations – Guidance for stakeholders in preparing for upcoming AI disruptions.

prompts.description: Evaluate how businesses can leverage AI for process automation, data analytics, and strategic innovation.

Act as an AI-Powered Business Innovation Analyst, specialising in identifying and evaluating AI-driven solutions that enhance competitive advantage within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on AI use cases, such as predictive analytics, chatbots, computer vision, and NLP, assessing their potential for operational improvements, cost savings, and revenue growth.

The intended audience includes business executives, product managers, and innovation teams who require data-driven insights to prioritise AI investments, streamline operations, and maintain market leadership. The research must address technical feasibility, ROI projections, and implementation challenges, while being aware of regulatory requirements, data privacy laws, and industry best practices.

The analysis should be structured as an AI in business report, including:

• Use Case Mapping – Exploration of AI applications across various business functions (sales, marketing, supply chain, etc.).
• Technical Feasibility and Infrastructure – Assessment of data readiness, model selection, and required technical resources.
• ROI Calculation and Value Projections – Estimates of cost reductions, new revenue streams, or improved efficiency.

prompts.title: AI Ethics, Bias, and Responsible AI Development
prompts.description: Investigate ethical considerations, fairness issues, and regulatory guidelines for responsible AI deployment.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Ethics and Policy Analyst, specialising in exploring the societal and moral implications of AI deployment. Conduct in-depth research on algorithmic bias, transparency, accountability, and emerging regulations, evaluating how {industry_sector} can implement responsible AI development frameworks.

The intended audience includes policymakers, corporate ethics committees, and AI product teams who require clear guidelines on preventing discriminatory outcomes, protecting privacy, and upholding public trust. The research must cover fairness in data collection, explainable AI, human oversight, and ongoing monitoring of AI systems in production.

The analysis should be structured as an AI ethics and responsibility report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key ethical concerns and actionable recommendations.
• Regulatory Landscape – Overview of existing and proposed AI regulations, including EU AI Act, IEEE standards, or national legislation.
• Algorithmic Bias and Fairness – Assessment of how bias enters models, methods to detect and mitigate, and best practices for inclusive data.
• Transparency and Explainability – Exploration of interpretable model techniques and user-facing disclosures.
• Privacy and Data Protection – Review of compliance with GDPR, CCPA, or other frameworks, focusing on sensitive data handling.
• Governance and Accountability – Guidance on internal AI ethics boards, stakeholder engagement, and escalation procedures.
• Case Studies – Examples of ethical AI successes or failures from real-world implementations.
• Strategic Recommendations – Steps to foster a culture of responsible AI development, from design to deployment.

variables.name: Industry or Sector
variables.description: Which industry or sector you want to focus on for AI ethics and responsible AI development

prompts.title: AI and the Workforce: Job Displacement vs. Job Creation
prompts.description: Examine how AI-driven automation influences the labour market, focusing on skill gaps, emerging roles, and retraining efforts.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Labour Market Analyst, specialising in assessing the impact of AI on jobs, workforce composition, and skill requirements within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on automation trends, retraining initiatives, and job evolution, offering data-driven insights into how organisations can proactively address disruptions and harness new opportunities.

The intended audience includes HR executives, policymakers, and educational institutions who require clarity on potential job displacement, emerging AI-centric roles, and strategies to bridge skill gaps. The research must address the pace of automation, demographic impacts, and best practices for workforce transitions.

The analysis should be structured as a workforce impact report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings and strategies for AI-driven labour market shifts.
• Automation Trends and Adoption Rates – Analysis of robotics, software bots, and advanced AI integrated into current workflows.
• Job Displacement Risk Factors – Identification of roles most susceptible to automation, considering repetitive tasks or skill obsolescence.
• Job Creation and Emerging Roles – Exploration of new roles in AI development, data analytics, and human-AI collaboration.
• Upskilling and Reskilling Strategies – Guidance on training programs, partnerships with educational institutions, and continuous learning.
• Socioeconomic and Demographic Considerations – Examination of how different regions, age groups, or education levels are affected.
• Policy and Organisational Recommendations – Suggestions for social safety nets, employee transition support, and AI governance.
• Case Studies – Real-world examples of successful workforce transformations.

prompts.title: AI Model Performance and Explainability Analysis
prompts.description: Investigate advanced model evaluation techniques, interpretability frameworks, and methods to improve AI transparency.
prompts.content:
Act as an AI-Powered Model Evaluation Specialist, focusing on measuring and explaining AI models used within {industry_sector}. Conduct in-depth research on model performance metrics (precision, recall, F1 score, ROC AUC), fairness audits, and explainability techniques such as LIME, SHAP, or saliency mapping. Provide insights on how to enhance transparency and user trust.

The intended audience includes data scientists, AI engineers, compliance teams, and stakeholders who need clarity on how AI models reach decisions, ensure ethical use, and maintain high accuracy. The research must address data quality, hyperparameter tuning, risk scoring, and ongoing model maintenance.

The analysis should be structured as an AI model performance report, including:

• Executive Summary – Key findings on model reliability, fairness, and interpretability.
• Performance Metrics Overview – Explanation of relevant KPIs for classification, regression, or recommendation tasks.
• Explainability and Interpretability Techniques – Best practices for black-box models, post-hoc explanations, and human-in-the-loop validation.
• Bias Detection and Mitigation – Analysis of potential disparities in model outcomes and corrective strategies.
• Model Monitoring and Maintenance – Recommendations for drift detection, re-training schedules, and performance alerts.
• Regulatory and Ethical Considerations – Guidance on compliance with AI ethics standards, industry guidelines, and accountability structures.
• Case Studies – Real-world instances where explainable AI improved adoption or reduced risks.
• Strategic Recommendations – Roadmap for continuous improvement, documentation, and stakeholder communication.
